Finally, Benny and Charlie answer some important questions that came from listeners like you at Freedom@CharlieKirk.com—questions about the Boston Tea Party, Tucker Carlson, and Star Wars.

episodes.title: Is 5G Dangerous? Social Media Censorship, How To Beat China In Tech Cold War, And MORE with FCC Commissioner Brendan Carr
episodes.description: Some of the most profoundly important debates of our time—big tech censorship and 5G—are issues than run right across the desks of the five FCC chairmen, one of which is Trump appointee Brendan Carr. Carr joins The Charlie Kirk Show to discuss what steps conservatives can take to correct the widely documented bias prevalent at Twitter, Facebook, and Google, as well as why Carr is optimistic about the future of 5G in America despite the looming security threats of China’s ambitious plans to spread its 5G network throughout the globe.

episodes.title: Police Officers Matter
episodes.description:
As calls by leftwing activists and Black Lives Matter organizers to “defund the police” gain momentum across America, progressive city mayors, city councils, and even the U.S. Congress are moving to reallocate resources away from “over-policed” communities and shockingly, to disband some police departments altogether. What will be the result of these previously unthinkable measures? Charlie unpacks the history of policing in America up to our modern era, explaining how modern police tactics developed in the 90s have actually led to the safest American city streets in a generation, gains that are in jeopardy of being lost to the detriment of minority communities who need the police the most.

episodes.description: Founder of American Greatness, writer, thinker, entrepreneur, and “New York Times” columnist, Chris Buskirk, joins The Charlie Kirks Show for a deep dive into the modern state of America First conservatism, how we got here, can it be sustained, and what will it transform into next? Tackling issues that impact our daily lives, Chris and Charlie delve into quality of life questions often overlooked by our pundits and politicians such as: How do  we improve nutrition for our citizens? Can we really repatriate American manufacturing jobs? Will Americans return to work the farms? And how do we reclaim the “normal” middle-class American life that has become a luxury for  too many?

episodes.title: Sec. Ben Carson | On Race, White Privilege, and How Black America Can Rise Up
episodes.description:
Housing and Urban Development Secretary, Dr. Ben Carson, joins the show to discuss the the racial turmoil gripping American cities across the nation, making sense out of how we got here and where we collectively go next. Sec. Carson also explains why he and his brother were able to rise from abject poverty in urban Detroit, becoming one of the world’s most renowned brain surgeons (and his brother a rocket scientist) before ultimately serving in the Trump administration. Finally, he discusses the cultural crisis raging in the black community, the damaging affect of fatherlessness and the drift away from the church and marriage, and most importantly, how we can recover from the current crisis and restore our national unity.

episodes.title: Bonus - Sneak Peek of 22 Hours: An American Nightmare
episodes.description:
It’s a case nightmares are made of. We’ve got your sneak peek into the new true-crime series, 22 Hours: An American Nightmare. It's the frightening story of a D.C. power couple, their 10-year-old son, and housekeeper who were held hostage, tortured, and brutally murdered inside their burning D.C. mansion. You won’t believe what happened during those last 22 hours alive, and the shocking trail of evidence that led police to the killer! Did he have help? Hear from key witnesses who reveal never-before heard details. Will this investigation lead to the release of newly-discovered and confidential audio recordings so the public can hear the trial for the first time ever? Listen to the first episode now: http://bit.ly/2XDFub0

New episodes will be available every Monday on PodcastOne.com and Apple Podcasts. 

Don’t forget to subscribe, rate and review!
